pullRequest.title: Avoid unnecessary setup and teardown in docs tests
pullRequest.bodyText:
The docs tests have recently been running much slower than before (see #49753).
The gist here is that with ILM/SLM we do a lot of unnecessary setup / teardown work on each test. Compounded with the slightly slower cluster state storage mechanism, this causes the tests to run much slower.
In particular, on RAMDisk, docs:check is taking
ES 7.4: 6:55 minutes
ES master: 16:09 minutes
ES with this PR: 6:52 minutes
ES with this PR and #51418: 5:48 minutes
on SSD, docs:check is taking
ES 7.4: ??? minutes
ES master: 32:20 minutes
ES with this PR: 11:21 minutes
ES with this PR and #51418: 8:29 minutes

nodes.bodyText: This one does not really contribute to the slowdown, but I found this one when I was investigating things and was repeatedly seeing  install-token-metadata cluster state updates (which become NOOPs) because the condition here is checking the wrong customs. /cc: @jkakavas
